title: Costa Rica 2016
description: Our vacation in Costa Rica for a week during May/June 2016.

title: Costa Rica Heliconia Island
description: We went to Costa Rica in 2010. We travelled around by a Hired car 4x4. We started in Dos Palmas near Alejuela. Our first thereafter was Mawamba Lodge then Heliconian Island, Peace Lodge,Linda vista, Ceiba Lodge,Blue Dream hotel, Elvera hotel Coco Palms, Miramonte Swiss,Casino Hotel, Trogon Lodge, Dos Palmas. All together about 2500 km. We found our way by using the Garmin Gps 60csx and the topo from Costa Rica. This worked out amazingly well.

title: Costa Rica underwater
description: Costa Rica underwater

title: Trip to Costa Rica 2016 Highlight
description: Trip to Costa Rica 2016 Highlight

title: Uvita, Dominical, Manuel Antonio, playa Ventanas, Costa Rica
description: Hey Everyone,,,, if you find yourself down in the Southern Pacific Zone of Costa Rica....I think you might want to check Playa Ventanas OUT.... Way COOL beach,,rustic and natural, off the beaten path, just what you want when you don't want the tourist 'thing'. Trust us...... it's worth a look.

title: Discover Cocos Island
description: Join us for an expedition to the World's most beautiful bbig-animal destination; Cocos Island.

title: Uvita Costa Rica La Cascada el Pavon
description: Hey Everyone,,,Travel a little south of Uvita and across from Playa Ocochal (Ojochal) take a left at the sign advertising the Tilapa El Pavon Restaurant. On the way to the restaurant (which we have a video about and also recommend) on the left hand side you should see the sign for La Cascada el Pavon (Turkey Waterfall). We highly suggest you stop and take the very short hike down to the waterfall and check it out. Way COOL! Don't take our word for it- Check out this video. Pura Vida!

title: Animal Rescue Center La Fortuna Costa Rica
description: If you're a wild animal lover and in the La Fortuna area, do we have the place for you. You can simply take a tour and/or volunteer for the day or even volunteer for a longer period by doing a home stay. You will live with a local Tico family and volunteer in the wild animal rescue during the day. They even provide Spanish lessons with the home stay program. This rescue center is doing great work and is definitely worth checking out even if you don't have the time to volunteer. Watch the video, it is very cute... and I loved holding an adorable baby howler monkey. .

title: Playa Uvita, Marino Ballena National Park
description: Laid back, rustic, natural, what's not too love. We're in Punta Uvita and nice beach in the Marino Ballena National Park. The draw here is not only the beach but the whale-watching tours leave from here (humpback whale). Anyway, check it out..great option just south of the more touristy Manuel Antonio.

title: Costa Rica beaches - Playa Santa Teresa
description: Flor Blanca is the ultimate luxury sustainable boutique beach hotel located on one of the best beaches in Costa Rica, Santa Teresa Beach, north of Mal Pais.

title: Cocos Island diving
description: On February 2013 I had the pleasure of diving in one of my long awaited dream diving destinations - Cocos Island in Costa Rica, a remote uninhabited island 500 km off Costa Rica mainland. The island is rich of pelagic fish including hammerhead sharks, tiger sharks, galapagos sharks etc. Although it was off season and the visibility was not so good due to cold thermoclines, it was still one of the best diving destinations I have been to.

title: Waterfall Rappelling Canyoning - La Fortuna Costa Rica
description: Travel Costa Rica Now's, michael alan & D'Angelo do Pure Trek's canyoning, rappelling adventure tour. Check it out to see what they think. ENjoY!

title: La Fortuna - Costa Rica
description: If you're in the La Fortuna area and love adventure or trying new things, this might just be the thing for you. Flyboard, very FUN. If you'd like to try it, then email us and we'll set it up for you or your group. ENjoY!

title: Tortuguero National Park
description: This is one of the few Costa Rican national parks where walking isn't necessarily the best way to see things. The marked trail along the beach is used mostly for observing turtle nesting, but the best way to see most of the park is from a boat. That doesn't mean you can't get a workout while nature watching; there are plenty of places to rent canoes and kayaks (cayucas or botes).

title: Tamarindo - Costa Rica
description: Tamarindo is one of the more popular tourist destinations in Costa Rica. Tamarindo offers a little bit of everything for everyone. Surf, chill on the beach, participate in water activities like fishing, boating, sightseeing etc.,, it's there. There's ATV's, horseback riding, ziplining and much, much more. So if you choose Tamarindo, you'll definitely have a good time. There's a nightlife too.....

description: This is a video I made for a Real Estate company in Montezuma that shows the magic and feeling of the wonderful places in and around Montezuma on the Peninsula de Nicoya in Costa Rica, Central America.

title: Playa Tamarindo, Costa Rica
description: Overview of Playa Tamarindo located on the northwest coast in the Guanacaste district of Costa Rica. This video gives you a great perspective of beautiful Playa Tamarindo with it's wide beach, casual attitude, and beginner level surf.

title: La Fortuna Waterfall Costa Rica
description: Hey EVERYONE! If you're visiting the La Fortuna Arenal Volcano area while traveling Costa Rica, we would definitely recommend you check out the La Fortuna waterfall if you have the chance. Nice 10-15 minute hike down, beautiful photo opps and you can always take a refreshing dip either in the waterfall pool or the more calmer parts of the river down stream. This waterfall video has some great footage and pics and is also fairly funny. So check it out and see what you can ENJOY when you're in the La Fortuna Arenal Volcano area. Pura Vida!

title: Arenal Volcano National Park, Costa Rica
description: From hanging bridges, ecological parks, small towns, hot springs and volcanoes, you'll never run out of things to do in Costa Rica.

title: Monteverde (Salvetura Park) Costa Rica
description: Monteverde, Costa Rica is a small town in Puntarenas, Costa Rica, located in the Cordillera de Tilarán. Roughly a four hour drive from the Central Valley, Monteverde is considered a major ecotourism destination in Costa Rica. The area is host to the Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve and numerous other reserves, which draw considerable numbers of tourists and naturalists.

title: Costa Rica, from Volcanoes to Beaches
description: A video collection taking you all over Costa Rica, from beaches to volcanoes to forests and rivers. This is the real Costa Rica as it was meant to be seen. Striking out on your own is the best way to see the wide range of sites this amazing little country has to offer.

title: Diving with sharks, Caño Island, Costa Rica
description: Diving with sharks, Caño Island, Costa Rica

title: Costa Rica Tours
description: From powerful volcanoes to black-sand beaches, from tropical dry forests to mangrove jungles, you'll encounter many natural wonders on this guided tour of Costa Rica, one of the most biologically diverse nations on Earth. You'll also experience the warmth of Costa Ricans, a welcoming people committed to preserving the natural beauty of their beloved country. This itinerary provides a journey into this fascinating culture at a pace that allows you to relax and explore in-depth.

title: Costa Rica Nature Highlights
description: Costa Rica is approximately the size of West Virginia. Incredibly, this small Central American country hosts around 5 percent of the planet's total biodiversity. This is largely due to the presence of tropical rainforests. Costa Rica's rainforests contain an incredible assortment of creatures—everything from spider monkeys to sloths to toucans can be found here. The plants are equally impressive and include orchids and walking trees.

title: Birds, Insects and Scenery
description:
Costa Rican Wildlife - Birds, Insects and Scenery
A mellow bird-filled morning and scenic afternoon.
Tadpoles, Tortoise Beetle, Army Ants and others appeared as the day progressed. At the Costa Rican Amphibian Research Center.

title: Scenery, Amphibians, Reptiles & Birds
description:
Costa Rican Wildlife - Scenery, Amphibians, Reptiles & Birds
Birds in the morning, a trip to Tapanti rain and cloud forest in the afternoon, and reptiles and amphibians at night. Most animals filmed at the Costa Rican Amphibian Research Center in Guayacan de Siquirres.

title: Insects, Birds, Amphibians & Reptiles
description:
Costa Rican Wildlife - Insects, Birds, Amphibians & Reptiles
At the Costa Rican Amphibian Research Center in Siquirres.
Went on a brief night walk with Brian Kubicki, the CRARC's founder and director, this first day there.
Species filmed included Slender Anole, masked Treefrog, Smokey Jungle Frog, Red-eyed Treefrog Tadpoles, Northern Ringed Snake and Red Poison Frog.

title: Crimson Cup
description:
Enjoy the wonderful sights of Costa Rica from the view of a Coffee Plantation.
Crimson Cup along with four independent coffee house community members enjoyed a visit to the La Minita coffee plantation. By working directly with the coffee farmers, we learn the needs and opportunities to help continue to create great tasting coffee. And, we know that through these direct relationships we can contribute to the sustainability of the entire plantation community.

title: The Springs Resort
description: When you visit The Springs Resort And Spa you will find yourself in the most luxurious adventure hotel Costa Rica has to offer. While on your Costa Rica vacation you will enjoy your time relaxing in the most beautiful hot springs Costa Rica has to offer. For some of the best Costa Rica day tours available you will want to check out our Club Rio outdoor adventures. If you are a thrill seeker, give our kayaking adventure a try, or simply relax and go tubing down the Arenal River.

title: Bhutan and Costa Rica
description:
Rural adventure tourism and community sustainable development
In Costa Rica, deforestation was once a major problem. The Fundecooperacion has helped to reverse this trend and turn El Tigre into a top adventure tourist destination thanks to its natural wonders.
